snippet: A key polar bear population fell nearly by half in the past decade, a joint study by the United States and Canada found, with scientists seeing a dramatic increase in young cubs starving and dying.
abstract: Joint study by United States and Canada finds key polar bear population in southern Beaufort Sea fell from about 1,600 in 2004 to about 900 in 2010, with scientists seeing a dramatic increase in young cubs starving and dying; researchers blame shrinking sea ice associated with global warming.
lead_paragraph: A key polar bear population fell nearly by half in the past decade, a joint study by the United States and Canada found, with scientists seeing a dramatic increase in young cubs starving and dying.

headline.main: Study Shows Polar Bears Disappearing in Region
headline.print_headline: Study Shows Polar Bears Disappearing in Region
